data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A solid piece of a hard substance, such as wood, having one or more flat sides.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Such a piece used as a construction member or as a support.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Such a piece upon which chopping or cutting is done.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Such a piece upon which persons are beheaded.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: One of a set of small wooden or plastic pieces, such as a cube, bar, or cylinder, used as a building toy.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A stand from which articles are displayed and sold at an auction.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: Many priceless antiques went on the block.

data.text: A mold or form on which an item is shaped or displayed.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
